Package main

Class MusicPlayerFacade

java.lang.Object
main.MusicPlayerFacade
public class MusicPlayerFacade
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Acer

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void exitPlayer()
    prints the commands of the playlist
    void nextSong()
    will stop the player before playing the next song updates the song number, could loop forward if song position will be greater than the size updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the play function of the player prints out a statement if next song is played prints out the current song without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method
    void pauseSong()
    checks if song is playing to invoke the pause method updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the pause function of the player prints out a statement if song is paused
    void playSong()
    set up conditional statements to be able to determine if the song is played or resumed initializes the MP3player to play the file updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the music player prints out the name of song if a new song has been played without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method
    void prevSong()
    will stop the player before playing the previous song set up conditional statements to check the current position in the playlist will be able to loop backward if song position is at index 0, else will decrease song position by 1 updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the play function of the player prints out a statement if previous song is played prints out the current song without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method
    void printCommands()
    prints the commands of the playlist
    void printSongList()
    prints the song list of the playlist uses listIterator method to traverse and print the elements of the song list
    java.lang.String removeExtension​(java.lang.String fileName)  
    void skipSong()  
    java.lang.String toString​(java.lang.String songPath, int songNumber)

  • Method Details

    • playSong

      public void playSong()
      set up conditional statements to be able to determine if the song is played or resumed initializes the MP3player to play the file updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the music player prints out the name of song if a new song has been played without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method

    • pauseSong

      public void pauseSong()
      checks if song is playing to invoke the pause method updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the pause function of the player prints out a statement if song is paused

    • nextSong

      public void nextSong()
      will stop the player before playing the next song updates the song number, could loop forward if song position will be greater than the size updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the play function of the player prints out a statement if next song is played prints out the current song without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method

    • prevSong

      public void prevSong()
      will stop the player before playing the previous song set up conditional statements to check the current position in the playlist will be able to loop backward if song position is at index 0, else will decrease song position by 1 updates the boolean values, playing and paused, after calling the play function of the player prints out a statement if previous song is played prints out the current song without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method

    • skipSong

      public void skipSong() throws java.util.InputMismatchException
      Throws:
      java.util.InputMismatchException - (thrown when a user inputs a character or symbol instead of a int number) will print the song list to let user choose which song position they would like to skip to Suppress warnings for leaked resource due to the scanner will check if entered input is in range of the playlist size set up conditional statements to check if song is curreently playing or not stops the current song playing and plays the song being skipped to prints out a statement if skipped song is played prints out the current song without the ".mp3" extension uses removeExtension and toString method

    • exitPlayer

      public void exitPlayer()
      prints the commands of the playlist

    • printSongList

      public void printSongList()
      prints the song list of the playlist uses listIterator method to traverse and print the elements of the song list

    • printCommands

      public void printCommands()
      prints the commands of the playlist

    • removeExtension

      public java.lang.String removeExtension​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Parameters:
      fileName - of the song file
      Returns:
      String removes the ".mp3" extension of the songs

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString​(java.lang.String songPath, int songNumber)
      Parameters:
      songPath - that is the directory
      songNumber - which is the current song
      Returns:
      String joins the song path and the song file into one string will be used to play the songs using the MP3Player class
